remarks: The supremum of a sequence of measurable, real-valued functions is measurable.  Note that in this and related theorems, ` B ( n , x ) ` is a function of both ` n ` and ` x ` , since it is an ` n ` -indexed sequence of functions on ` x ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Sep-2014.)

mbfsup.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( n e. Z /\ x e. A ) ) -> B e. RR ) $.
mbfsup.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> E. y e. RR A. n e. Z B <_ y ) $.
mbfsup $p |- ( ph -> G e. MblFn ) $.
